alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Mountains; Santa Barbara County South Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 13 at 3:43AM PST until December 14 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE ALISAL BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... The Flash Flood Watch continues for * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Alisal burn scar. * WHERE...The Santa Ynez mountain range and adjacent coastal foothills in southern Santa Barbara County in southwest California. * WHEN...From this evening through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Alisal burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Alisal burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

area.areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Mountains; Santa Barbara County South Coast
